moves.1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. e3 Bg4 4. h3: This move is a tad out of the norm for me :)
moves.4... Bf5 5. c4 Nc6: Need to still check the DB if this is a good/right move, but given the history with me it would been a good/right move.
moves.6. cxd5:
Again something "out of the norm" for me :)
But the "best I believe given 5 .. Nc6
moves.6... Nb4: Given the pawn on d6, it's the wrong order of moves,
moves.7. Qa4+: I believe this was the move that swinged the game.
moves.7... Qd7: yeah, since you can't do Nc6, but still might've been "beter"
moves.8. Qxb4: I considered 8 Bb5, but the c6 , 9 dxc6 Nxc6 and the advantage is gone.
moves.8... O-O-O:
This also wasn't such a good move, as there wasn't much support for a7.
I would've played b6, followed soon by e5, attacking Q on b4, and pushing to e4
moves.9. Qa5 Kb8: Not a6, as I would've attacked (in my norm ;^) with 10. Bxa6, bxa6 11. Qxa6 , positional advantage, still two pawns ahead
moves.10. Nc3: Needed to get "some" protection for d5, but also needed badly to start developing
moves.10... b6:
not "bad" .. attempting to get Queen away.
At this point I'd rather play 10...Qd6 and following 11. Nb5 Qb6 preventing mate.
I believe this move just tipped the scale badly in my favour.
moves.11. Qa6 Nxd5:
a tad late/early??
Rather 11...Qc8 followed by QxQ or Qb7
or even  11...c6 to prevent the mate attack
moves.12. Ne5: 12 Nb5 would've been fooled with 12.. c6 and advantage lost
moves.12... Qe6:
I had conditional moves ready for 12.. Qc6 13 Nc6  Ka8 14 Qxa7#
and 12 .. Qd6 13 Nb5 Qb4  14 Bd2 and then I'll have a checkmate coming in the next two moves..
at this stage geig73 made this move ;)
